snippet: Investors around the world were on edge after François Hollande’s victory, with unease rising about the future of the euro zone.
abstract: Power shift in France, where Francois Hollande is preparing to take over as the country's first Socialist president in 17 years, may prove to be one of the most significant changes in Europe during its sovereign debt crisis; investors around the world are on edge as unease rises about the future of the euro union.
lead_paragraph: Investors around the world were on edge after François Hollande’s victory, with unease rising about the future of the euro zone.

headline.seo: Markets to Give France a Grace Period, Analyst Says
headline.main: Markets to Give France a Grace Period, Analysts Say
headline.print_headline: Grace Period for France As Markets Digest Election
